text: amazon cloudwatch application insights
automate your application monitoring a
walkthrough
amazon cloudwatch application insights
identifies and sets up key metrics
logs and alarms across your application
resources and technology stack
continuously monitoring them to detect
and correlate anomalies and errors
it creates automated dashboards for
detected problems which include metric
anomalies
log errors and additional insights to
point you to a potential root cause
allowing you to take remedial actions to
keep your applications healthy
in this video we will discuss how to
onboard your applications into
cloudwatch application insights
customize your monitoring settings for
application components
and view insights about your
applications
let's create our application using aws
resource
groups we can choose to make this group
based on
tags or from a cloud formation stack
i'm going to demonstrate using tags
for simplicity i'm going to include just
one state machine in the group
although you can include any other
resources supported by cloudwatch
application insights
as long as they share the same tag
now i'm going to name my application
and then create it now in the aws
console
navigate to the cloudwatch dashboard
then scroll to settings at the bottom
now in the application insights box
select
view then get started
here we can select the name of the
resource group we just made from the
drop down
and then we can choose whether we would
like to monitor cloudwatch events
and whether we would like to integrate
with aws systems manager op center
let's leave those both enabled for now
and select next
here we see all resources in the group
we can choose to remove them if we don't
want them to be monitored
and then re-add them later this looks
good for now so let's hit next
if your resource supports log paths you
can configure them here
now review and submit your changes
great job you just made your first
application
you can manage monitoring for the app as
a whole here
or for individual components here
let's manage the monitoring for our aws
step functions resource by selecting it
and then selecting manage monitoring
you can select your application tier
here
if you want cloud watch application
insights to capture and report critical
events from your resource logs
you can set them up here
let's add our state machines log group
by clicking add new log
then selecting the log type
then filling in the log group name using
the auto filler
you can feel free to add additional log
patterns if you're interested in
particular kinds of events
other than what cloudwatch application
insights configures for you by default
just select them from the drop down here
finally you can feel free to remove your
log if you don't want it to be monitored
or you can add new logs here
here you can choose the metrics you'd
like cloudwatch application insights to
monitor
some key defaults are provided but you
can select additional ones from the
dropdown
or you can disable metrics by selecting
the x button beside them for each metric
you choose to monitor application
insights will create a pre-configured
alarm for you
that triggers when that metric reaches a
critical state for instance if you
enabled executions failed
an alarm will be set that triggers when
one or more executions fail other alarms
such as execution time
runoff anomaly detection strategies
built into application insights
these will be triggered when the metric
behaves abnormally
finally you can feel free to add
additional alarms if you would like to
monitor additional metric behavior
just create them here in the custom
alarm section at the bottom
when you're satisfied with your
monitoring configuration select the save
button to begin monitoring
now how does cloudwatch application
insights deal with problems
here's the mystery aws step function
state machine we just onboarded for
monitoring
as it turns out it's a little
ill-behaved it's been failing while we
were away
if we hadn't come here how would we have
known how would cloudwatch application
insights capture the problem and point
us to a solution
if we go to the main amazon cloudwatch
dashboard
we see that the alarm that application
insight set up to monitor our execution
failed metric
has been triggered catching our
mischievous state machine red-handed
down here in the application insights
dashboard a corresponding problem has
appeared
referencing our state machine let's have
a look at the problem summary to find
out what our trustee new tool has found
about the problem
here amazon cloudwatch application
insights has summarized the error in the
form of an insight
identifying a root cause and linking us
to responsible sub-resources
so that we can mediate the issue below
is prepared a dashboard displaying the
triggered alarm so we can quantify the
error
beside it is a group of captured
failure-related log events which allow
us to examine the context of the error
more closely
aws step function state machines are far
from the only resources the amazon
cloudwatch application insight supports
you can also monitor your amazon ec2
instances
amazon rds clusters aws lambda functions
amazon dynamodb tables amazon s3 buckets
and more if you have any more questions
feel free to reference the resources
listed in the description
best of luck keeping your troublesome
applications in line
